captions.text:
Welcome to the League of Legends Champion
Spotlight, featuring Rek’Sai, the Void Burrower.

The queen of the feared Xer’Sai that hunt
in Shurima’s desert, Rek’Sai is the region’s

apex predator. Unseen and unrelenting, Rek’Sai
senses distant movement and burrows beneath

the surface as she moves in to butcher her
prey. In game, Rek’Sai is a mobile and powerful

threat who stalks her prey’s movements before
closing in for the kill via her tunnels.

Since Rek’Sai’s abilities change if she’s
below the ground, we’ll start with her W, Burrow.

Burrow is a low cooldown ability that
sends Rek’Sai just beneath the surface where

she ignores unit collision and gains increased
movement speed, but loses access to her basic
attacks and - most importantly - vision range.

Along with different abilities, she gains
Tremor Sense, which passively reveals all enemy and

neutral movement in a large area around her.
Note that Tremor Sense can differentiate between

enemy champions and other targets, but can
only detect movement - Rek’Sai cannot feel

out enemies that stand still. If they stop
moving, they will disappear from view.

Even though she has drastically reduced vision,
she can still see targets who hit her with

abilities and basic attacks. Finally, even
though Rek’Sai is underground, she is not

hidden from her opponents: They can see her
just as easily as any other champion.

While burrowed, Rek’Sai can then Unburrow with
her W. As she unburrows, her vision returns

to normal, but she loses her subterranean
bonuses. Unburrowing beneath enemies damages
them and knocks them into the air - and it knocks them higher if Rek’Sai’s directly beneath them - but

while Burrow and Unburrow both enjoy low cooldowns,
the same target cannot be knocked up by Unburrow
twice in quick succession.

Stay burrowed as you move around the map - the
extra movement speed will take you through

your jungle faster, and get you in place for
ganks. Use Tremor Sense to track enemies over
unwarded parts of the map.

Rek’Sai’s passive is Fury of the Xer’Sai.
Rek’Sai gains fury as she deals damage with

basic attacks or abilities and loses it when
she stays out of combat for an extended period.

Whenever Rek’Sai burrows, she starts consuming
her fury, regenerating her health. Unburrowing

ends the heal, but also preserves Rek’Sai’s
remaining fury.

Make the most of Fury of the Xer’Sai by
burrowing whenever you’re out of combat

and have fury to burn. The regen can keep
you alive in the face of damage over time

abilities, and if you’re clearing camps,
will keep your health topped up, meaning you can

carry on earning gold and experience while
less awesome junglers have to head back to
base to heal up.

Unburrowed, Rek’Sai’s Q is Queen’s Wrath,
which causes her next three basic attacks

to deal bonus damage in an area around her.
Queen’s Wrath has an extremely low cooldown

AND resets Rek’Sai’s attack animation,
so well-timed casts will significantly increase

her damage output. Just as important, Rek’Sai
generates fury from every enemy struck, making
Queen’s Wrath her fastest get mad tool.

Use Queen’s Wrath whenever you’re fighting
large camps or in teamfights. To maximize

the healing from your passive, prioritize
clearing the raptors and murkwolves.

Whenever Rek’Sai burrows, her Q changes
to Prey Seeker, which fires a pulse of void

energy in a target direction. If the pulse
hits a target, it detonates, dealing area

of effect damage while revealing all struck
enemies.

Use Prey Seeker to scout ahead as you counter-jungle.
Unless they’re fighting, jungle monsters

won’t show up on your Tremor Sense radar
- Firing Prey Seeker into a camp will tell
you if it’s occupied.

While Unburrowed, Rek’Sai’s E is Furious
Bite. This single target attack deals increasing

damage based on Rek’Sai’s fury; at max
fury, it deals true damage to her victim.

Save Furious Bite for executions so that you
ramp up as much fury as possible before using it.

This way you’ll maximize your damage
from the ability. And if you’re contesting

a valuable jungle camp, time Furious Bite
with Smite for a higher chance of success.

Rek’Sai’s burrowed E is Tunnel, a fixed
distance dig in any direction that creates

tunnel entrances at the dig’s start and
end. Once she’s built a tunnel, Rek’Sai

- but only Rek’Sai - can travel back and
forth through it, slipping under obstacles
and walls as she pleases.

Tunnels last several
minutes but each has a unique cooldown that

stops Rek’Sai from ducking back and forth
repeatedly.

Even though Rek’Sai can create tons of tunnels
before she hits the cap, they aren’t indestructible.

Enemies can collapse tunnels by standing on
them briefly, that is, unless Rek’Sai’s

actually in it - that would just be rude. Once
an enemy spots a tunnel, it’ll stay on their

minimap until it’s stepped on or collapses
on its own. Finally, Rek’Sai can’t use

her abilities while she’s tunneling, because
that would be OP.
She can smite though. That’s totally fine.

Use Tunnels to create an immense underground
network throughout the map. The huge mobility

boost they provide will allow you to approach
your prey from unpredictable angles.

Rek’Sai’s ultimate is Void Rush, which
has a passive and active effect. Passively,

it increases Rek’Sai’s attack speed. Rek’Sai
can activate Void Rush by targeting one of

her tunnels anywhere on the map - after a
brief channel, she screams globally and dives
underground, speeding toward the tunnel.

There are a few notes worth pointing out here.
First, Void Rush’s initial channel will

be interrupted if Rek’Sai takes damage from
enemy champions or turrets, or if she’s

hit with any form of hard crowd control. That
said, she cannot be stopped once she’s

actually started her dash, which takes the
same amount of time regardless of how far
away the targeted tunnel is.

Also, though Rek’Sai can use Void Rush while
burrowed and unburrowed, she always emerges

from her target tunnel in burrowed form. Finally,
her opponents cannot see where she’s headed

unless they can see the tunnel exit she’s
headed to.

Use Void Rush to quickly reposition after
you respawn or recall. The global scream apparently

scares the bejeezus out of the enemy team
here, who all back out of their dragon attempt
after they hear Rek’Sai ulting.

Whereas some counterjunglers thrive on locating
the enemy jungler and outright killing them

in a duel, Rek’Sai prefers to work from
the shadows and pick unfair fights. She excels

at being where the enemy jungler is not
and grabbing their camps before they’re

even aware of your invade. Here’s a quick
guide in how to turn your opposing jungler
into an emotional wreck...sai.

Start by using the knowledge provided by Tremor
Sense as you skirt around the edges of the

enemy jungle. If there’s no sign of the
enemy jungler, fire a prey seeker into a camp

to check for mobs. If the camp’s occupied,
burrow directly in before getting to work

on the monsters’ health bars with Unburrow
and Queen’s Wrath. Secure the primary kill

with Furious Bite before using your original
tunnel to sneak back out to safety.

As a hunter, Rek’Sai loves to fight the
enemy jungler after they’ve already been

weakened by jungle monsters. With your tunnels
established, keep an eye out for prey. If

you spot them getting their butt kicked by
one of their camps - like the new and improved

raptors maybe - why not ult in and give them a helping
hand? By which of course I mean kill them.

Having access to more abilities than most
champions makes Rek’Sai’s early ganks

incredibly potent, so make sure to get into
lanes as soon as you’ve picked up your basic

buffs. Here, Rek’Sai looks for the Unburrow
knock up, then builds as much fury as possible
so her Furious Bite deals extra damage.

Once you’ve hit 6, keep an eye on all the
tunnels you’ve dug around the map for quick

and safe Void Rush kills. Spotting Orianna
wandering into her territory, Rek’Sai rushes

to the nearest tunnel before Twisted Fate
and Shen ult in for a pretty epic case of
overkill.

Rek’Sai’s the queen of chasing down and
picking off fleeing enemies, even super mobile

champions like Kassadin. Most would have to
give up the chase after watching him Riftwalk

away, but not Rek’Sai. Using an existing
tunnel before digging a new one gets her close

enough for a clutch flash unburrow. Get Rekt,
Kassadin!

Remember that Rek’Sai is not a supertank,
and while the speed boost from tunneling can

quickly get her into the enemy team, it doesn’t
mean much if her allies are way too far behind

to support her. Here she’s quickly turned
into void sushi when she chases too far.

Here’s Rek’Sai in her element, using her
pre-placed tunnels and suite of tools to their

maximum potential as her teammates deal damage
from the backline. Following on Thresh’s

hook, Rek’Sai Unburrows under Fizz for the
knock up, forcing an early Zhonya’s. But

the fight turns sour, so she backs off through
a pre-placed tunnel, re-engaging with a new
tunnel as Shen pulls off a great taunt.

Rek’Sai wants to chase here, so she burrows
mid-fight, healing up with her passive as

she catches up to, and knocks up Shyvana.
With the fight won, Rek’Sai looks for the

clean up, burrowing once more and tunneling
behind Morgana before knocking her up
and securing the ace.

Thanks for tuning in to the Rek’Sai Champion
Spotlight. Please subscribe to the Riot Games

YouTube channel and leave us your comments
just below the video.

comments.text:
DotA, HoN, Smite, their characters have skill sets that work well together 
and have synergy. Most of LoL's champions are just a mashup of skills that 
barely make sense together.

HoN was on this same schedule, making one new hero every 2 weeks, and it 
killed the game by flooding the character pool with a bunch of unoriginal 
characters that made it even harder for new players to learnt he game.﻿
